TopicTitle: The K Prize - 100% reusable spaceplane to orbit and back

Articles.Content:
> 
> 
> On 9/21/2017 at 1:00 AM, TheGuyNamedAlan said:
> 
> 
> may i still submit?
> 

Of course ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Congratulations once again to [@JacobJHC](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/152333-jacobjhc/) for completing an evidently carefully planned mission to take a lightweight spaceplane to the distant location of Gilly and thereby qualifying for the K-Prize with plaudits.

- Exploratory Astrokerbal Distinction with [Gilly <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3177221) (12.203t).

Welcome back to the roll of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list.

> 
> 
> 9 hours ago, boolybooly said:
> 
> 
> Welcome back to the roll of honour aka the K-Prize party guest list.
> 

Thanks! I have another destination in mind for this class of SSTOs, I'm not sure when, but soon it will launch for another vault around the Kerbol system...

I think it's time for me to renew my K-Prize license. The last time was so long ago it's untrue -- KSP 0.23.5, I believe.

Here's the Clipper taking 24 Passengers to the space station:

![screenshot139.jpg](http://ksp.schnobs.de/Kprize/screenshot139.jpg)

[Gallery](http://ksp.schnobs.de/Kprize/Clipper.html)

Do passengers count as "cargo"?

Was messing around and got my MK2 <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> into a 75x75 orbit with over 6,000 <abbr title="Delta-V">DV</abbr> remaining! Can pretty much go anywhere. Landing in 2nd video after I burned off some fuel...

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/7Eaf0tMhyFY?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="344" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/3FivWaNhHyA?feature=oembed" width="459"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2017-09-28T02:07:17Z" title="09/28/2017 02:07  AM" data-short="6 yr">September 28, 2017</time> by g00bd0g**
  
changed my entry...

Congratulations to...

[Laie](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3180450) Advanced Pilot Precision Award 1st Class with Clipper.

[g00bd0g](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3180973) Advanced Pilot Precision Award with Mk2 <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>.

... on completing the K-Prize mission with flying colours. Thanks for your mission reports and welcome back to the K-Prize roll of honour aka party guest list.

Re passengers [@Laie](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/110461-laie/) since they have no mass they dont count as cargo but docking to transfer them counts as an Advanced Pilot Precision Award and combined with the runway landing/taxi this contributes to an APPA 1st Class.

[@g00bd0g](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/74045-g00bd0g/)

![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

Well, passenger modules are quite a bit more massive than an empty cargo bay of the same length... nevermind.

Thank you for taking the time and looking at my stuff. And everybody else's, for that matter: You're doing a public service which is woefully under-recognized.

> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> Thank you for taking the time and looking at my stuff. And everybody else's, for that matter: You're doing a public service which is woefully under-recognized.
> 

Thankyou Laie, good of you to say so, much appreciated ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-04T19:57:22Z" title="10/04/2017 07:57  PM" data-short="6 yr">October 4, 2017</time> by boolybooly**

Entering the challenge with the Yatsykon Concept Co. Dimetrus - 1, my first <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> since I started playing KSP in alpha 0.16 (Wow, that's so far away. Couldn't have imagined what KSP looks like now from back then. Much easier to play nowadays, back in my day we didn't get no fancy schmancy "patched conics").

Images should finish uploading by the time you see this, forgot to take photos pre-orbit.

[https://imgur.com/a/fpEWV](https://imgur.com/a/fpEWV)

I have a question about the rules regarding decoupling.  Can I build a craft with engine pods that I can leave in <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr> while I deliver cargo to other planets and then come back and re-attach them before I land?

Yes [@Thor Wotansen](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/157596-thor-wotansen/) but K-Prize achievements only count while the craft is whole because, while ingenuity is commendable in its own right and interesting to see, the aim of the K-Prize is to test the capabilities of spaceplanes entire.

So if you drop a payload into orbit as a whole craft then it counts, what you then do with it is up to you, the K-Prize accomplishments only count while the craft is entire, so if it splits nothing more counts until it reassembles.

Congratulations to [@Yatsykon](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/173683-yatsykon/)...

[Yatsykon](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3196906) with YCC Dimetrus.

... for completing the K-Prize. Thankyou for your mission report and welcome to the roll of honour.

A while ago I did this with a stock plane. I have now designed spaceplanes of my own. I went to orbit and back with the Fang V4, and to the Mun and Minmus and back with the Aegis V6.

Edit: After rereading the awards, I suppose I should mention a Duna landing and return with the Farscape V2. I also docked an Aegis V6 with a Drone V3 over Kerbin. I can't land on runways worth crap so I always land on terrain lol

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-18T03:06:35Z" title="10/18/2017 03:06  AM" data-short="6 yr">October 18, 2017</time> by paneledberry**

Going through the challenges, I saw this one and I was like "Gosh, why didn't I ever do that one before?". I jumped straight into the action and made a spaceplane. Soon after I was reminded why exactly I didn't do it before, I'm horrible at building and flying spaceplanes. But I did manage it this time, be it hardly... 

The craft of choice was a modified version of a supersonic crew transport I made for a different challenge, I swapped out some crew compartments for fuel tanks and tadaa! A functional space plane. The thing is called the Arenal-S, being a spacegoing version of the Arenal jet.

![Fvw30iI.png](https://i.imgur.com/Fvw30iI.png)

takes off horizontally ofc, it being a plane after all...

I cruise up to 9000 meters to start my speed run. Just gotta clarify that I really have no idea what the most efficient way is to get a space plane into orbit, I just flew horizontally at speeds of 1200m/s up to a height of 14 kilometers, then to pull the nose up steeply, raise the apoapsis and starting to fire the rocket engine soon after to get my apoapsis up to orbital height.

I did land at <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> 2, I don't know if that counts as <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> territory or not.

Full album: [right here](https://imgur.com/a/7Q7bW)

Hope this qualifies as a functional space plane!

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-22T12:44:21Z" title="10/22/2017 12:44  PM" data-short="6 yr">October 22, 2017</time> by panzerknoef**
That's a really pretty plane! I'm surprised you wings actually didn't melt off. Those have a rather low heat tolerance.

> 
> 
> 3 hours ago, qzgy said:
> 
> 
> That's a really pretty plane! I'm surprised you wings actually didn't melt off. Those have a rather low heat tolerance.
> 

Thank you very much! And yes, they came quite close to melting off, I did my reentry in 2 times cuz they were overheating so much... Thankfully they have a lot of lift so it was quite easy to just hop out of the atmosphere for that. Also,  "pretty" sadly didn't make it very efficient, I hardly got it into orbit, probably cuz of extremely bad piloting of my part, but still...

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-22T18:28:40Z" title="10/22/2017 06:28  PM" data-short="6 yr">October 22, 2017</time> by panzerknoef**

Here's a video I made of my MK3 <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, Magical Trailblazer. It can carry an orange tank to orbit and fly back. ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D")

The flight path is fairly simple just keep a 10 degree angle and raise the nose to 40 when you engage the rapiers.

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/_VxQ-vyQOwE?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

I just flew my first fully re-usable <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> to orbit and then landed back on the <abbr title="Kerbal Space Center">KSC</abbr> ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif ":D") Images: [https://imgur.com/gallery/Aoh06](https://imgur.com/gallery/Aoh06) Oh, and They never Siad i wasn't alloed to land, Flip around while braking and just keep flatspinning... I faced forward again after a few spins...

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-28T08:54:46Z" title="10/28/2017 08:54  AM" data-short="6 yr">October 28, 2017</time> by HamnavoePer**

> 
> 
> On 10/22/2017 at 2:44 PM, panzerknoef said:
> 
> 
> Just gotta clarify that I really have no idea what the most efficient way is to get a space plane into orbit,
> 

Any launch you can spacewalk away from... "Most efficient", in your case, would only be some refinement. Maybe go supersonic right after takeoff before going into one uninterrupted clim? This may or may not work better. I expect the overall difference to be slight either way. By and large, you're doing it right.

Nice plane, btw. Looks much bigger than it actually is.

@qzgy: those wings also have a lot of surface area to radiate with, you can adjust the heat load by <abbr title="Angle of Attack">AoA</abbr>. They also have enough mass to not go poof in an instant, so you have time to react and see it work.Try it, it's fun! Returning from Minmus is totally possible, though not in a single pass.

I achieved the K-Prize 2 years ago with a crazy 12 engine flying wing,

![vIFnxJym.jpg](https://i.imgur.com/vIFnxJym.jpg)

but I haven't played since then, so I decided to resurrect one of the last projects I was working on, a Thunderbolt II configured circumnavigator, capable of landing anywhere on Kerban and returning to KSP.  The high mounted engines and wings allowed for safe waterlandings.  For kicks, I replaced all the <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr> tanks with <abbr title="Liquid Fuel">LF</abbr>+O tanks and made it an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr> with the idea that it could possible work as a more effective spaceplane on Laythe then what I currently have, which isn't optimized for water landings at all.  Discovered that it actually works, despite not being ideal for spaceflight at all.  The reason I'm posting in here again is because the Thunderbolt II configuration is somewhat unusual for an <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>, and this is my first K-Prize video.

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/jXGZ1fFFgCk?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

So what's I've learned from my Thunderbolt II

Pros:

Looks very distinct from nearly every angle.

Excellent aerobreaking capabilities, was able to glide all the way back to the runway.

Docking Port aligned with centerline.

Water Landing Capable

Heat Resistant

Cons:

Engines not aligned with the ship's centerline.  Limited thrust in space.

Inefficient aerodynamics.

Inefficient fuel efficiency.

Limited Delta-V, 2k when fully refueled.

... for completing the K-Prize mission successfully. Thankyou for your mission reports, well played and welcome to the guest list for the very exclusive K-Prize party aka the roll of honour. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

**Edited <time datetime="2017-10-31T09:35:37Z" title="10/31/2017 09:35  AM" data-short="6 yr">October 31, 2017</time> by boolybooly**

> 
> 
> On 22/10/2017 at 1:44 PM, panzerknoef said:
> 
> 
> Going through the challenges, I saw this one and I was like "Gosh, why didn't I ever do that one before?". I jumped straight into the action and made a spaceplane. Soon after I was reminded why exactly I didn't do it before, I'm horrible at building and flying spaceplanes. But I did manage it this time, be it hardly... 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> The craft of choice was a modified version of a supersonic crew transport I made for a different challenge, I swapped out some crew compartments for fuel tanks and tadaa! A functional space plane. The thing is called the Arenal-S, being a spacegoing version of the Arenal jet.
> 
> 
> 
> 
> I cruise up to 9000 meters to start my speed run. Just gotta clarify that I really have no idea what the most efficient way is to get a space plane into orbit, I just flew horizontally at speeds of 1200m/s up to a height of 14 kilometers, then to pull the nose up steeply, raise the apoapsis and starting to fire the rocket engine soon after to get my apoapsis up to orbital height.
> 

Optimum height for speedrun is just under 17km on Whiplash,   but it sounds like you're close enough.    So long as you're hitting over 1000m/s what you do on jet power isn't that important.    On rocket mode, it is best to just pitch for best lift/drag ratio rather than "pulling the nose up steeply".  So if your wings aren't angled up , that'd be about 5 degrees above prograde, if you have angled wings, and it looks like you do have built in incidence, then just fly as close to prograde as possible without having the nose actually go below prograde.   If you angle the canards up a bit in the <abbr title="SpacePlane Hangar">SPH</abbr> so that the plane flies with a small positive <abbr title="Angle of Attack">AoA</abbr> with no control input,  you can just set prograde hold on <abbr title="Stability Augmentation System">SAS</abbr> at this point and it will take care of giving you the most efficienct angle.

However, you've got low melting point airliner wings and a pointy cockpit so you may need to cilmb straight up to avoid melting.   With an inline mk2 cockpit and big S wings, heat is less of a worry.

Also note - 

you have a lot of liquid fuel storage, you could perhaps think about fitting a nerv or two to make use of it.

the mk2 fuselage pieces have awful drag characteristics.  mk1 tanks of the same capacity have significantly less drag, even better are wings and strakes if you are just storing liquid fuel.

Just a question: how big would my <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">ssto</abbr> need to be to make the maximalist challenge? Also I'm going to say that a turboprop counts as a payload as it fullfills all the requirements.

I won't use any fuel on the stock turboprop and I won't be using the lift generators *prior* to separation.

Been a while since I last submitted an entry to this, so here's another I knocked up a few days ago.  Built along the lines of the SR-71 Blackbird, but designed to deliver small satellites to <abbr title="Low Kerbin Orbit">LKO</abbr>, I  present **Blackbird <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>**

**Take off**

![bbssto01.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/bbssto01.jpg)

**In orbit**

![bbssto02.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/bbssto02.jpg)

**Payload delivered**

![bbssto03.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/bbssto03.jpg)

Nearly home

![bbssto04.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/bbssto04.jpg)

**Mission success**

![bbssto05.jpg](http://www.88qv.com/KSP/bbssto05.jpg)

Craft file can be downloaded from Kerbal X and comes complete with the small relay satellite  -  [https://kerbalx.com/Scarecrow88/Blackbird-<abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>](https://kerbalx.com/Scarecrow88/Blackbird-SSTO)

Congratulations to ... [@Scarecrow](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/65767-scarecrow/) on completing a classic payload to orbit mission with a classically stylish bird.

- Utilitarial Commendation, Advanced Pilot Precision Award with [Blackbird <abbr title="Single Stage to Orbit">SSTO</abbr>](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/11189-the-k-prize-100-reusable-spaceplane-to-orbit-and-back/&do=findComment&comment=3217342).

The honour of the K-Prize is yours once again, thanks for your report and welcome back to the K-Prize party guest list. I found your earlier entry with Jeb's Limo btw and added the Blackbird as above as a second entry.
Thanks [@boolybooly](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/profile/6572-boolybooly/)
